Review.Titre: Hire better employees
Review.Contenu: Hire better employees. I am taking all of my business elsewhere because your mail service deleted emails and your employees (Philip) don't want to do their jobs to recover the emails. They are making me repeat myself while blaming other carriers which I don't use as they've been told repeatedly. I told him I want a refund for the URLs I paid for before they were set to expire but he blew that off and just sent me a link to move my URLs elsewhere. So much for your self proclaimed great customer care. >:-(UPDATE:18 days after reporting the problem and 7 days after their response to my negative Trust review, ABSOLUTELY NO ONE from the Admin Team ever contacted me after repeated requests and NOTHING was done to find the emails that disappeared from the email service I was paying for Porkbun to provide! A customer should not be asked 4 different times by 4 different employees that are not in the admin team, the same questions over and over, just to be blown off at the end. I stated that I'd be taking my business elsewhere if the missing email issue wasn't resolved. Instead of resolving it, Philip the head support manager sent me a link to transfer my business elsewhere. I will be reporting this to the BBB as well as the Attorney General Consumer Affairs as this is a paid service I paid for and your employees don't want to do the tedious work of recouping the emails that disappeared.UPDATE: Spoke with India and told her my issue and that I needed to talk to someone above Philip the Support Manager as my complaint was about him. She called me back a few minutes later after she reached out to other members in her group and said they weren't going to be able to do anything about the emails their company lost AND that I could NOT speak to anyone above Philip to complain about his poor customer service.She also stated that they would NOT refund my money for 4 of my domain names that I was going to transfer from their service WHICH were paid for a week ago, and haven't expired before needing to be renewed. I have almost $200 of domain URLs and email service I was paying yearly for which they are losing because of the poor service.TOTALLY FALSE ADVERTISEMENT ABOUT MIND BLOWING CUSTOMER SERVICE! I'm reporting this company to the BBB and the Attorney General's Consumer Affairs department.

Review.Titre: Why is it suddenly so expensive?
Review.Contenu: Why is it suddenly so expensive?Edit:  I mean specific new(er) domain extensions across the board are *significantly* more expensive than others.  "Basic economics" is a pretty silly cop-out non answer.  It doesn't cost any more to store that row in a database, and there isn't any more competition for every single .io or .ai domain across the board compared to their .com counterparts.  It really feels like price gauging - whether it's by Porkbun or the layer below...Aren't YOU the registry??

It's so stupid that I'm not even too lazy to leave a review about it.--Response to response:You try to console yourself by thinking that this review is written by one person. At the same time, you complain to trustpilot about bad and truthful reviews, and apparently you write positive ones to yourself. If you go to other popular sites like reddit or just Google, it's obvious that many people don't like you there. So piece reviews here from several people are a drop in the bucket. I'm sure there are a lot more such reviews, you're just trying to delete them.I will be extremely surprised if this review is not deleted. Simply because you are trying to play against the generally accepted norms of morality. However, the result of your actions is dust in the eyes of potential consumers. Anyone who sees your requirement to submit documents to register a domain will simply go to another registrar.

Review.Titre: Do you want to register? Prepare your passport!
Review.Contenu: At work, I have long used the services of porkbun, no less than the services of other registrars. But now I needed to register a domain for myself. I wanted to create a personal account. But when creating an account, they require me to provide photos of documents, confirm contact details, and so on. This is the first time I have seen such stupid restrictions for registration (including domain registration) with a registrar.Of course, I'm not going to provide photos of my documents just because they wanted to.I use the services of more than a dozen registrars, but porkbun is the first of the registrars where I saw such stupidity. I am very disappointed, even though it was previously my favorite registrar. Apparently now, in order to avoid risks, I will be forced to transfer from them all the domains that we registered for clients.

Review.Titre: Renewed email, deletes all prior emails!
Review.Contenu: Porkbun has greatly disappointed me in the most significant manner. Following an email renewal this weekend, all of my emails have vanished, and there is no trace of them on the server. Unexpectedly, everything has been wiped clean, despite it being a routine renewal. The response I received was, "There is nothing on the server for your email." This is crucial information regarding the technique to achieve crispy bacon, and now it's all gone. I am experiencing a complete breakdown, and I have firmly decided to never utilize this service again.

Review.Titre: Two domains suspended with no good reason
Review.Contenu: There's something weird going on with Porkbun. It used to be a great service, but lately they've been suspending my domains improperly. On the first domain, they claimed "crypto phishing" (there is none), suspended for a few hours, then reactivated. In the second domain, they claimed "phishing" and a 48 hour notice, I contacted them and they replied: "Hello, I have unsuspended the domain [...]." However, the domain was suspended even with this message! I emphasize that I am against phishing and illegal things, and if that happened, it's not my fault, and I don't have a hosting account on Porkbun to upload files or codes, just the domains. In addition, I have verified my ID on Veriff.com (by request).

Review.Titre: This company allows scammers
Review.Contenu: This company allow scammers to purchase, run and abuse their services. I have contacted them, gave them the evidence and yet they refuse to put a stop to these people. Obviously, business with crooks is business as usual.As you can see by their reply, little interest in the harm selling their products do to others. I have reported them to ICANN and I suggest anyone who is scammed by people using their domain names, sold, registered and maintained by these people, that you sue them for the damages.A very hard bar you say, well how much effort do you expect the general public to go to before it is obvious it is a scam. If you see thousands of the same item in facebook that all have the same image and all go back to websites of all the same design on lots of URL's. Then its about time the registars did something, your taking their money and helping them rob from others.And yet here you are, poor response with zero concern. I'm sure one day you will be forced to vet people before dishing out domains to scammers.Since my last update, I have discovered a huge network of crime being delivered by porkbun's services. I have made them aware of this and I am also contacting their local law enforcement. However, they need to also take action. Washing your hands of responsibility is not good enough.

When I emailed Porkbun about it, they declined to provide any clarification whatsoever.

Review.Titre: I am generally happy with the service but
Review.Contenu: I am generally happy with the service. They offer competitive prices for domain names and I am a loyal customer. However, recently I tried to migrate my WordPress website from another hosting company to Porkbun and my experience was terrible.They only support a third-party plugin to migrate and that third-party plugin requires you to purchase a premium plan if your file is big. That was my case. Why do I have to pay for the third-party plugin to migrate to Porkbun? It doesn't make sense... Also, the support staff was rather irritated than supportive. I decided to stay with my current hosting company which is more customer centerd and has support available 24/7. If you want just a simple domain name provider, it does the job but if you face problems the support is email only and worse than the others.

Review.Titre: Porkbun is basically terrific, but..
Review.Contenu: Porkbun is basically terrific. Nice interface, secure. Super-competetive pricing. Works well. Unfortunately, they have recently added a feature which is very distasteful - automatic enrollment in auto-pay on domain registrations. You simply cannot complete a payment without enrolling in auto-pay. Yes, they say (in the fine print) that they provide a method to later opt-out of auto-pay, but this has things exactly backwards. It should not require a customer to opt-out of automatic payment without having first consciously opted-in.I understand the benefits of auto-pay for vendors, but it should still remain as an opt-in option, not an "opt-out (if you even knew we opted you in) deal"Now, I'm going to have to re-evaluate my choice of registrars. The shine on my otherwise five-stars opinion has faded..A better option on their part would have been to offer a positive incentive for folks to enroll in auto-pay. They have numerous incentive deals already. They should just put a positive incentive on auto-pay, too

Is denying this fact?I insist, "You must not force the auction during the autoRenewPeriod of the expired domain without my consent."I have the right to refuse to proceed with your illegal auction during the automatic renewal period (30 days) of the expired domain."However, my right to refuse has been seriously violated. For this reason, I am suffering serious mental damage.You are causing me serious mental damage. Please be aware of this fact.This kind of illegal activity is not done in Korea. Review.Titre: Terrible support.
Review.Contenu: Shortly after purchase, the domain stopped allowing any kind of changes (dns, nameserver, anything at all).  I reached out to support and was told there was nothing they could do, that my new, none production domain was no longer usable on their dns, nor on cloudflares.  When I attempted to find out why I was told they couldn't provide any reason why.  I pushed and pushed and was told they would look into it on Monday, (it was the weekend).  Monday comes and goes with no response for 15 days.  Finally I sent 1 final email and was prepared to dispute the domain purchase with my bank.  They responded to the email and said they would check, less than 12 hours later the issue was completely resolved, with no explanation as to what happened.  Next email was for a review of my experience, so here we are.

Review.Titre: Very mixed experiance from me
Review.Contenu: Very mixed experience from me. They are a good provider offering domains at a competitive price. However the way they handle abuse complaints is not good (At least it wasn't in the past but I am unsure of current business practises). While I am not sure if it is still in practice, Porkbun would suspend your domain without contacting you first if they receive an automated Google safe search warning regarding the domain. This happened to me in the past where google detected a false positive and Porkbun suspended the domain. It was clearly a false positive since I didn't modify the website whatsoever and submitted it back to google and it was approved as being clean with nothing wrong; this took maybe a few hours to 1 day for google to verify. Porkbun left the domain suspended for days and wasn't very informative at the time because it was the weekend and abuse department was only monday to friday. This I found to just be a terrible business practise, i understand the need to remove abuse but the steps in place at the time of it happening to me need to be changed as it seems like there was no human intervention or double check and my domain was disabled just because of an automated google warning. This isn't the first time this has happened either, you can lookup Porkbun domain suspended / suspension topics on forums such as LowEndTalk, Reddit, etc...

Review.Titre: Guy on the chat was useless.
Very bad crypto operating.
Email Catch-All forwarding not provided, big hassle
Review.Contenu: I'm a veteran domain owner now for over 20 years. I know how to manage domains.After reading glowing reviews, Porkbun had me sold, I was just about to transfer all my domains to Porkbun, but when I happen to discover that catch-all email forwarding was not provided I stopped. Catch-all forwarding is a very important facility that most email users would find useful and many power users will eventually require.Porkbun's excuse is that is stresses their servers, so I was reluctant to believe that. I've had no problem with previous registrars, and I've managed to stop spam after it arises. It's a lot of hassle setting up email address and preventing spam without a catch-all forwarding facility.Porkbun's solution is to disable that altogether, for the benefit of their own servers, which makes me think they don't have very good infrastructure, or are on the cheap with low grade AWS hosting. Really, their reason for not offering catch-all's is lame and i transferred my domains elswhere.One thing I am upset about is that Porkbun never makes it clear on their promotionals or signup pages that catch-all is not provided, I had to find out from Reddit forums. Gotta love reddit.

Review.Titre: It is not very user friendly
Hosting so slow, my web dev won't touch it!
Review.Contenu: I'm actually shocked to see the 5 star reviews. I was thrilled to try out an affordable alternative to some of the 'big names' but it's left a bad taste in my mouth.Prior to signing up for hosting - I chatted in to get information because their own site was so slow it kept kicking me out and 504'ing. I was assured it was because of how quickly they're growing, and it doesn't impact their hosting at all. Super. Load. Of. Crap. My site's not even done yet, has less than 4 products on it, css is minified, everything is compressed and it is still taking 5 seconds before the FIRST ping! I work on sites daily (SEO) and I have never experienced such a slow site. (Hello, 1997?) I sent it to my web dev and he won't even touch it until I switch hosting providers, because he says there's nothing he can do until I get new hosting (it's not worth it to try, apparently, it's that bad.)When I emailed in today, I was told that the 'hosting isn't for everyone' and is a 'one size fits all.' Uhh. That would have been nice to mention before I bought my 4 domains through PorkBun, especially when I specifically asked. Cannot recommend. And I'm locked into their hosting for 2 months apparently. So I guess I can launch my new site (with the products i've worked tirelessly on for 8 months) in 2 more months... after I switch hosting. Ludacris.1 star because it forces you to leave at least 1. +1 additional star for a cute mascot.

Review.Titre: Backend password storing is broken! Unacceptable!
Review.Contenu: I wasn't able to create an account on the website. Tested on two devices. Website returned 403 Forbidden. Emailed support, they responded very quickly, told me it could be related to my VPN and that I should tell them my IP address so they can "investigate further". After I disclosed my IP address they ghosted me! I send them another email the next day but they didn't answer again. Very unprofessional!I managed to successfully create an account after three days from another computer at home. I think I got the reason why it wasn't working in the first place: It was because of the password which contained Extended ASCII characters! At least give the user a message that they should pick a password without them instead of just throwing "403 Forbidden" on a blank page!But it doesn't end here. After I purchased my domain for two years I logged out for a while and then tried to log back in. Password didn't work! My intuition tells me it's because it starts with a single quotation mark (it was generated randomly by the password manager). Not even regular ASCII is handled properly in the backend! I did manage to change my password and it went ok from there on, but it took me 3 days of tinkering just to register an account. You shouldn't need to pick a simpler (and thus more crackable) password just to please a dysfunctional form backend.Other bad things: The website is mess. The "Contact Us" link in the footer is just a blank javascript. That's just laughable (in a sad way).Good things: Although they ditched me after a short correspondence, the initial response was pretty quick. Sadly, this and the competitive pricing are pretty much the only good things about Porkbun. It does have a lot of potential but I'm going to rate it for what it is and not for what it could be.Honestly the review should've been one star but I'm trying as hard as I can to be objective.

Review.Titre: I renewed 2 domain names...
Review.Contenu: I renewed 2 domain names, one .com, one .org. Both were transferred on the same day and now renewed at the same time. Not only did you charge more for the .org but it also expires before the .com.End result, they no longer have the same renewal dates. You were doing so well so, what do you guys have against .org?

Review.Titre: new CC and when I was sent to "Stripe", it didn't recognize it
Review.Contenu: First, you would not let me update my zip code on my credit card.  It was off by one digit, the last one.  How did that happen?  Did you guys truncate it?  I don't know if it worked when I first purchased, but I think it did.Then I entered a whole new CC and when I was sent to "Stripe", it didn't recognize it at all, so I had to re-type everything again.  Previously with the wrong zip code, Stripe at least had that number automatically, so it sometimes works.  We'll see if it auto renews correctly next year.The rest of the website seemed to work and it was fast.

Review.Titre: Good but they increase prices without notice
Review.Contenu: I like the interface and all, but the renew price just keeps increasing without any previous notice! It's now almost 25% more expensive than when I first registered the domain.

Review.Titre: I wanted to use a catchall mailbox for…
Review.Contenu: I wanted to use a catchall mailbox for my email addresses, and some unaddressed posts seemed to indicate that routing email through a Porkbun-registered domain would somehow limit the catchall functionality. If I've misunderstood this, please address it on your site. I only registered domains for which email isn't a possibility. I would register more if this issue was made clear. Otherwise, I found the site easy to navigate.

Review.Titre: Too much junk mail and phishing scam…
Review.Contenu: Too much junk mail and phishing scam emails. Porkbun needs to do a better job of protecting its clients from suspicious emails.

Review.Titre: PayPal watch out.
Review.Contenu: I was paying with PayPal and a page came up with a 'Review and Continue' button. I thought there was another page before I confirmed payment but the payment went through on that click.

Review.Titre: Your platform is a beautiful platform
Review.Contenu: Your platform is a beautiful platform. The only problem I found is the payment problem. My bank card is often rejected despite the availability of money, which makes me buy from other platforms.

Review.Titre: Paying for the new domain was/is a bad…
Review.Contenu: Paying for the new domain was/is a bad experience.  The form kept telling me that my phone number is invalid, which it isn't.  Then I received an email thanking me for my order.  Now it looks like my card was charged twice.  I  hope I'm not going to have an issue having the 2nd charge credited to my card.

Review.Titre: Payment bounced back, customer service helped out.
Review.Contenu: The first three times I tried to pay for my domain the payment bounced back. I had to contact Porkbun customer assistance, which solved the problem quickly, which is great - but the system should work smoothly, hence the 3 stars. I hope this gets fixed soon.

Review.Titre: You replaced my public_html root…
Review.Contenu: You replaced my public_html root directory and I lost all of my files

Review.Titre: I was forced to try a new registrar…
Review.Contenu: I was forced to try new domain registrars since Google Domains tossed its customers in the trash, as they usually do. Like most other companies in the registrar space, unfortunately Pork Bun is just meh. I am sure the networking stuff behind the scenes works great...I hope, but coming from Google, this UI/UX is just a sad disappointment and downgrade.  - Streamlined domain search, Google Domains was much better at giving suggestions and presenting the myriad of domain results to the user. Pork Bun feels unintuitive and endless scrolling of the same results. - "Refresh the page" in 2023 should not be a thing. The UI should refresh the page when it knows transactions and updates are complete. -  The user's list of purchased domains looks like a clone of 90s Hosting control panels. - The DNS management loads in a modal and has horrible UX. This might seem like nitpicking, but this is what made Google Domains so attractive, they did one thing and did it extremely well. I hope one of these days somebody comes along and just does domain management for software engineers the right way.

Review.Titre: Wouldn't accept my card
Review.Contenu: Wouldn't accept my card.  I had to log in to privacy.com, generate a single-use card, and then use it to pay at checkout.  The same thing happened earlier this week.  It's annoying.It's also a little heartstopping noting that the payment screen is not hosted on porkbun.com...

Review.Titre: Payment was easy but prices are misleading
Review.Contenu: Payment was easy but prices are deceptive & misleading. It's not until you reach checkout that you realise prices are in USD & not in AUD. I checked settings & there is no way to update your currency preferences.

Review.Titre: Need more automated help in pointing…
Review.Contenu: Need more automated help in pointing domains from others hosts to pork in so I can actually use the domain.

Review.Contenu: Site is well organized, domain prices are ok, free SSL is nice but 3 month expiry period is a bummer and hosting prices are EXPENSIVE. Hence and average rating...

Review.Titre: Lovely with some culprits
Review.Contenu: I appreciate the communication and client-oriented behavior you showcase; the tone of the emails, the content, and the offers provided by Porkbun are impeccable.The user interface and experience, however, aren't the most optimal; and the fact that there are much fewer Porkbun resources than for other providers is bothersome for me.

Review.Contenu: I made the mistake of using my real phone number when buying a new domain. Although I changed to 555-1212 first thing in the morning, I got 29 calls and 8 texts the first day from people asking me to use their marketing or website services. It’s 3 days later and I’m still getting 15 calls and 5 messages per day.

Review.Titre: Good prices but the platform is buggy…
Review.Contenu: Good prices but the platform is buggy as hell. I repeatedly bring up the same issue over and over again but they never fix it and new ones keep popping up. I wouldn't recommend keeping any valuable names here as I am skeptical of their ability to secure their platform.

Review.Contenu: I'm not big fan since my domain expenses doubled because of "premium" status. 5 years it was regular and now for some reason not. Next year I'll consider if I really need to renew.

Review.Titre: Cheap service costed me more
Review.Contenu: Low price was the biggest reason that attracted me to Porkbun, and admittedly they does provide the lowest domains list price and normal services are good enough.However, the disappointing part was that when .ONE domain announced to double price, Porkbun failed to take it serious. The reminder was sent only once and one week before the price doubling from a promotional email address with distracting emojies in title. Not surprisingly, this important email was automatically classified as promo by email filter and hence missed.Had Porkbun took the reminder more serious, I would of course choose to renew 10 years with old price. But now I have to spend more money every year to renew my .ONE domain subject to the doubled price.

Review.Titre: Great company.
Review.Contenu: Payment process not straight forward. My payment was rejected several times for no apparent reason. Other than being over cautious perhaps.Or maybe that's just a sign of the times.Wouldn't stop me using or recommending pork bun to anyone wanting to register their web site.

Review.Titre: Great Pricing & quick support, but transactions may get incorrectly blocked
Review.Contenu: The pricing at Porkbun is super transparent and very affordable - depending on the TLD, they may have the cheapest pricing across all registrars. The whole UI is excellent and management options are very easy to find and change.However, I had to try making my purchase five times before it went through. I contacted support about this and they responded within 7 (originally said 36 hours because I cannot maffs) hours. They said that "It looks like the IP address you are connecting from has a fraud reputation associated with it. Can you try connecting to us from a different network?".I've had this IP from my ISP for less than a year now and I have no idea who had it before me. The "solution" they suggested does nothing to improve user experience and obviously doesn't deter fraud. The fifth time, I completed the purchase over Mobile Data via my work SIM.

Review.Titre: OVER 24 HRS TO COMPLETE THE PURCHASE
Review.Contenu: I tried to use a pre-paid VISA card to pay, but it was rejected multiple times. The Customer Care team instructed me to complete verification steps in order to validate the payment. I did it all. I even submitted my ID card and waited more than 6 hours afterwards. Once again, the payment did not go through. I had to use another card to complete the purchase. Why is that bothering me? 1. Using a not pre-paid card compromises protection; 2. Having to wait over 24 hours to simply pay. Don't get me wrong! I appreciate you caring for customers' financial security and applying procedures against fraud, but should be working more efficiently. Otherwise, it is going to backfire.

Review.Titre: Ok hosting can do better
Review.Contenu: Great hosting can do better. When I first joined Porkbun, they offered the cheapest prices. But things have taken a turn, other providers now can offer way more cheaper prices. While yes, Porkbun still offers I'd say some of if not the best first year prices, things have changed. Companies have better after first year pricing. But I must say for the price, the quality of the domain management is some of the best. However, I'm kind of disappointed that they do not offer live chat, if they do I can never seem to find them online. E-Mail is fast. But other registrars even cheap ones offer live chat. I like the Cloudflare DNS thing they do in domain management. DNS records are smooth sailing too. Nameservers change fast too. So I'd say price, and support is where Porkbun can do better.Edit feel its annoying and dumb that they just auto renew your mail plans with no option to turn off auto renewal.

Review.Titre: There is a delay of 30 mins in…

Easy set up of host email and forward email Cons: There is a delay of 30 mins in receiving emails from other accounts to host email/forwarding gmail and delay of 2-5 mins sending email outbound from gmail. I reached out to the help desk and they said there is some issue with mail server from couple of days and it should get resolved soon but still i see lag in receiving emails and sending as wellAlso the website purchased via porkbun is very basic and in black n white but i expected a better version of website in basic plan.

Not for me. I ONLY use Porkbun for selling me the .ski suffix to a URL. I do not use them for hosting or any other service. I simply buy the name from them online. I think the suffix price is crudely expensive, but that is the case for almost everyone. So did they provide my expectations 100%  But I am not sure how they could acheive a 1 star or a 5 star when I had no service involvement with them at all.

Review.Titre: Difficulties with payment
Review.Contenu: Stripe did not accept the Georgian TBС bank card for payment. I had to create an account on Coinbase and pay with cryptocurrency. Add the exact amount to be paid, not just an offer to refill the account.

Review.Titre: They fake whois info on their whois server for .cloud and .work renewals.
Review.Contenu: They fake whois info on their whois server for certain domain renewals. .cloud and .work TLD renewals.They take the renewal money but do not propagate the whois info outside their own whois server.In the case of the .cloud domain the domain registry confirmed they had not renewed.They now say that they wait for the end of the renewal period outside the expiry date to actually to the renewal and they say this is the practice of every registrar.Edit: FYI What they call the "Autorenew period" is outside the Expiry of the domain. So there is about a month when other global Whois servers show your domain as expired. The only Whois server that will show it in date is their one. That is what I mean by faking the renewal.No matter how much I insist they process the renewal they refuse. The only option is to get a transfer code and transfer the domain to keep it safe.And then they give a refund because the transfer is for that year and not for the next year. Because it was not actually renewed.And there is no option to manually renew it on their website in this "Autorenewal Period" because the website pretends it has already been renewed. Hence me calling it a fake renewal.

Review.Titre: Not as convenient as it should be.
Review.Contenu: I've been such a fan of porkbun that I decided to transfer my last remaining domains over. The process was not smooth. First my credit card was charged but the transfers remained in my cart. I had to contact support, then re-paste the auth codes in the bulk transfer form from scratch FIVE TIMES. I inquired about paying with ACH (bank account) to get a lower price for each domain. Again, have to contact support. I wait for them to verify my bank account, which takes 2 days. Then, instead of just having a button for ACH at checkout, I have to buy credits in advance and wait for them to be made available, which took five days. In the meantime, I wanted to register a new domain. I could add it to my cart, but I had to wait until the credits were available before I could pay. I could not charge my credit card unless I canceled the ACH-only setting, which requires that I ... yeah ... contact support. It was Sunday evening, so had to wait another day. They do respond quickly during business hours, but I tend to do things outside business hours. So, very inconvenient. I wish things were more automatic. Sadly, they are raising prices again, but it's apparently industry-wide. The prices are still much better than my last registrar.

Review.Contenu: Kudos for the quality of support, patience, and professionalism of support agents.It did take around 1 week for me to resolve my issue, mainly because of the time difference between mine and PorkBun's operating hours.The UI's counterintuitiveness in some aspects and non-round-the-clock customer support IMO increased the ticket's longevity from a potential couple of hours to a week.

Review.Titre: Offers cheap price for domains. Stay away if you want to set up custom email hosting.
Review.Contenu: I purchased a domain from them due to the cheap price. UI isn't as polished as other domain providers out there but it was manageable and functional.When I was setting up Zoho mail on my domain, I found a bug where it doesn't save MX records when the host is set to "@". Their documentation claims that it should support it, but actually throws an error when you add MX records with an "@" host. I expected the MX record to be added as "@.mydomain.com", but instead only shows "mydomain.com". After 2 hours, I couldn't set up my Zoho mail properly so I looked for alternatives.I thought that this "bug" was a ploy to get me to purchase their email hosting service... so I bought it for $24 AUD / year (they only do bulk billing). I set up their email hosting as specified in their documentation... and everything worked except for the automated acknowledgement email I send whenever my support inbox receives an email.When an email is sent to my support inbox, the automated response only comes in if the webmail UI is opened. When the automated email is sent to the customer, it goes to the spam folder instead of their inbox. I sent an email to Porkbun's customer support to talk about this. They said that my email hosting is set up correctly in my domain. I gave information about where the issue is but they never got back to me. It's been 2 weeks!TLDR; If you're purchasing a domain and you don't need to support email hosting in the future, use Porkbun. If not, don't use this service due to inaccurate documentation and buggy email hosting.

Review.Titre: I've been a Porkbun customer for 3…
Review.Contenu: I've been a Porkbun customer for 3 years. In that time I've spent just under $17,000 on domain registrations for clients. Last week I had a request to submit ID - no problem and it was done using their automated system within 24 hours. Yesterday I had a mail to say they hadn't heard back and the account was at risk of suspension. Again, I've no problem with that and immediately mailed back to say it had in fact been completed.Today I've gone to register more domains for my clients and received a message to say the account was now suspended. No investigation or mails to me to say it hadn't actually been received - just a straight suspension of the profile. To treat a client who has put through so much business this way is beyond belief. I'm hoping that this piece of feedback may speed up a response to the 2 mails that I'm yet to hear back on...Edit updated to 3 stars - I love the simplicity of the site and prices but this experience leaves a bitter taste. I resolved the issue myself by contacting livechat who undid the suspension but throughout the conversation offered no apology.

Right now it looks like this (partial screenshot to hide personal info): imgur[DOT]com[SLASH]a[SLASH]sK0iY97, but I would like it to be more like this, as I came from google domains with a very good management console (pic from google): imgur[DOT]com[SLASH]a[SLASH]19rjEQi.I understand that you may be busy, but could this be considered for a future update?Note: Trustpilot doesn't allow links, so I had to use placeholders

Review.Titre: Porkbun is my goto for domain…

When I contacted support I was told that there system flagged the name because the name contained a word that could be used for scamming people. The word was "loyalty"! Of course, it was not my intention to scam anyone. I was creating a rewards program website. In my opinion companies should not be censoring people. Other than that; I will continue to use Porkbun's service as long as they remain a great company to do business with.

Namely around discovery.I am part of the google domains diaspora, and on their platform discovery was fantastic. The better your discovery gets the more domains I will buy :)One thing that would be nice is when searching if you had a big list of ~100-200 of the top selling domains as suggestions for the query.Currently it feels like I have to wade through so many crappy ones. Every search I make starts with .boston. I am not from boston, dont live in boston, never want to. I am never ever ever going to buy a .boston domain.It would also be nicer if the visual queues for what is available and what isn't were made clearer and easier to browse. Its feels like that information should be directly next to the domain name so that when the reader browses their eyes don't have to scan as much.

It had been a while since I worked on anything so I didn't know. I had a really hard time telling if I was even in my account. It was just weird. In fact it looked like I was signed out. I should not have to wonder. I really don't like the way their site functions. It also got hung up with a spinning pig tail but that could be a browser issue.

Review.Titre: Technically friendly, honest about registrar policy
Review.Contenu: Porkbun technical support appears technically literate, they can use both average & technical vocabulary as needed: experienced users can directly talk about technical issues & receive technical questions, which is a plus.Porkbun also has a blog containing an article that defines exactly how they decide to expire a domain, what the redemption fees are, and which criterias are used to define a domain name as premium.This blog article cans be found in some related pages of the main Porkbun website.User accounts can be secured with appropriate methods such as Google Authenticator's.The Porkbun dashboard is lightweight & directly displays important details of a domain name, however one risky point is the mobile version of the dashboard.I think Porkbun cans work this out, it's when you use the mobile version then click on the "eye icon" to view the WHOIS privacy status.On mobile if you click it, it directly switches the WHOIS Privacy setting, so it could accidentally switch it to "Public" by mistake.By default it's enabled, so as long as you don't misclick it on mobile there's no problem for WHOIS Privacy.Porkbun also appears more lighthearted than competitors.It's like comparing EA Games with an indie game development company.There's also no 'big corp.' feeling when using the Porkbun website, which is confirmed by their to-the-point website navigation (no cluttered menus, easy-to-browse account settings).I don't say that they provide a better service than other registrars because unlike food, DNS registration is always the same service.However Porkbun clearly appears more lighthearted, to the point, and honest about their registrar policies.If you're going to pay a fee, they'll tell you in advance. You will also easily be able know how much you'll pay and how to avoid having to pay a fee.On a more technical note, Porkbun supports DNSSEC, CAA records and the ALIAS record too.ALIAS isn't really a DNS record type, but rather a "reverse-proxy" for another DNS record - cans be any record type.
